answers.answer: Hello.Your situation is difficult. I appreciate your efforts and concern for your kids. Your peripheral neuropathy should be explored further for possible causes.Do you have diabetes? Diabetic neuropathy can present in a similar fashion.Did you have any infection prior to this neuropathy came up? Do you have weakness of the lower limb muscles?Are there any symptoms in the upper limb as well? We can try to zero in on a few diagnoses.Regards

question: i'm 27 years old, and for 2-1/2 weeks, my feet have been 'asleep'.  it started a bout 2 weeks ago, with just my feet. and afte a few days, i noticed that my lowers legs felt 'numb' to the touch, *** well as my buttocks and groin areas.i went to the ER and i was diagnosed with PN. there were no tests performed, only questions asked. i was prescribed  an anti-inflammatory and muscle relaxers, and was told i'd feel better in a week. well, i didn't, and i have 2 small children, so i can't take muscle relaxers 2 times a day! i don't feel any difference at all. i went to a chiropractor. i feel no difference. i've even done accupuncture, and all i got from that is a pain in my back, literally, from the needles.should i seek a second opinion from a different doctor? there is no evident cause for this. i'm starting to worry.
title: idiopathic peripheral neuropathy?
